url.imageAlt: A very old photo of the hotel with a sign atop that reads “Hotel Prince Edward” in big white letters

description: The Piccadilly Lounge in the Prince Edward Hotel opened in 1954, and was later raided in 1967. Out of the approximately 100 people at the party, 11 men where charged. One of the men charged was W. Courtland, who was also later charged at the Vesuvio bathhouse in 1969 for assault. The site was closed in 1967, and demolished in 1976.
